definition: see 一之為甚|一之为甚[yi1 zhi1 wei2 shen4]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Wei
to speak/to say/to name/to designate/meaning/sense
variant of 什[shen2]
what/very/extremely/any
once is more than enough (idiom)
has eyes but can't see (idiom); unable or unwilling to see the importance of sth/blind (to sth great)
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
to win without a fight (idiom)
national danger, but no support (idiom, from Analects); the future of the nation is at stake but no-one comes to the rescue
one-sided words/prejudice/flattery
to praise sb in his presence
variant of 耄倪[mao4 ni2]
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
battle-ax and boiling cauldron (idiom); facing torture and execution
the morning dew will swiftly dissipate (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
old grudge/long-standing resentment
to say one thing and do another (idiom)
to defect/to be disloyal
knife, saw, ax and hatchet (idiom); facing torture and execution
see 矯枉過正|矫枉过正[jiao3 wang3 guo4 zheng4]
